subject: assertNotEquals
msgSnippet: Has anyone written an assertNotEquals method?  For example, if you are testing a method with a certain input that should cause an exception and thus some kind
messageBody:
Has anyone written an assertNotEquals method? For example, if you are
testing a method with a certain input that should cause an exception and
thus some kind of error message, you would want to assert that the output is
different than what it would be if the anticipated exception is not thrown.

I wrote this:

private void assertNotEquals(Object shouldNotBe, Object actual)
{
if(shouldNotBe.equals(actual))
{
fail("should not have been:<" + shouldNotBe.toString() + "> but
was:<" + actual.toString() + ">");
}
}

For some reason I'm not very comfortable with it. Does anyone have any
ideas for a better way of doing this?

Thanks,
-Brian
